results.title: Hollywood’s Last Real Movie Star
results.abstract: At a time when superheroes dominate the box office, the film industry hopes the actor can bring grown-ups back to theaters.

results.title: ‘Men’ Review: Putting the ‘Male’ in Malevolent
results.abstract: Alex Garland’s latest film stars Jessie Buckley as a woman whose peaceful trip to the countryside turns creepy and allegorical.

multimedia.caption: Jessie Buckley as Harper, who rents an English cottage that turns out not to be very relaxing, in Alex Garland’s “Men.”
Jessie Buckley as Harper, who rents an English cottage that turns out not to be very relaxing, in Alex Garland’s “Men.”
Jessie Buckley as Harper, who rents an English cottage that turns out not to be very relaxing, in Alex Garland’s “Men.”

results.title: Cannes Film Festival 2022: Politics Mixed With Moments of Grace
results.abstract: “Top Gun: Maverick,” “Tchaikovsky’s Wife” and other movies each get polemical in their own way. But there are scenes of lyrical beauty, as in “Scarlet.”

multimedia.caption: Tom Cruise in the new sequel to his 1986 blockbuster, “Top Gun.”
Tom Cruise in the new sequel to his 1986 blockbuster, “Top Gun.”
Tom Cruise in the new sequel to his 1986 blockbuster, “Top Gun.”

results.title: What Does It Mean to Live in Ukraine? Filmmakers Offer Their Answers.
results.abstract: Some, like Sergei Loznitsa, choose to use history as a filter. But the movies that stand out forgo monumental statements for personal ones.
des_facet: The Earth Is Blue as an Orange (Movie)

multimedia.caption: In the documentary “Babi Yar: Context,” Sergei Loznitsa repurposes Soviet propaganda to examine cycles of violence in Ukraine.
In the documentary “Babi Yar: Context,” Sergei Loznitsa repurposes Soviet propaganda to examine cycles of violence in Ukraine.
In the documentary “Babi Yar: Context,” Sergei Loznitsa repurposes Soviet propaganda to examine cycles of violence in Ukraine.

results.title: Cannes 2022: How Jessica Chastain Played Donald Trump’s Sister
results.abstract: The director James Gray based the cameo on an actual incident from his childhood, but filling the role proved quite a challenge.

multimedia.caption: The cameo that has turned the most heads at Cannes came from Jessica Chastain, playing Maryanne Trump.

results.title: ‘Downton Abbey: A New Era’ Review: Gilded, Aged
results.abstract: The latest entry in the “Downton Abbey” franchise is amiable enough — though despite its subtitle, it rests most of its extravagant weight on cozy familiarity.

multimedia.caption: From left, Harry Hadden-Paton, Laura Carmichael, Tuppence Middleton and Allen Leech in “Downton Abbey: A New Era.”
From left, Harry Hadden-Paton, Laura Carmichael, Tuppence Middleton and Allen Leech in “Downton Abbey: A New Era.”
From left, Harry Hadden-Paton, Laura Carmichael, Tuppence Middleton and Allen Leech in “Downton Abbey: A New Era.”

results.title: At Cannes, Vincent Lindon Still Can’t Believe He’s Jury President
results.abstract: As the star of a Palme d’Or winner, he’s seen how the award can change lives, so he takes his duties seriously.

multimedia.caption: Vincent Lindon said he expected the experience of serving as jury president would change him: “My own cinema world won’t be the same.”
Vincent Lindon said he expected the experience of serving as jury president would change him: “My own cinema world won’t be the same.”
Vincent Lindon said he expected the experience of serving as jury president would change him: “My own cinema world won’t be the same.”

results.title: Crafting a Rom-Com That’s True to 21st-Century Gay Life
results.abstract: Billy Eichner and the “Bros” team made news by casting queer actors, but they also focused on writing a story that didn’t recycle straight tropes.

results.title: Watch Jessie Buckley Take a Haunting Tunnel Walk in ‘Men’
results.abstract: The writer and director Alex Garland narrates a sequence from his film.

multimedia.caption: Jessie Buckley as Harper, who rents an English cottage that turns out not to be very relaxing, in Alex Garland’s “Men.”
Jessie Buckley as Harper, who rents an English cottage that turns out not to be very relaxing, in Alex Garland’s “Men.”

results.title: Vangelis, Composer Best Known for ‘Chariots of Fire,’ Dies at 79
results.abstract: A master of the synthesizer, he won an Oscar for that film’s score, and his memorable theme song became a No. 1 pop hit.

multimedia.caption: The composer and synthesizer player Evangelos Odysseas Papathanassiou, better known as Vangelis, in 1976.
The composer and synthesizer player Evangelos Odysseas Papathanassiou, better known as Vangelis, in 1976.
The composer and synthesizer player Evangelos Odysseas Papathanassiou, better known as Vangelis, in 1976.

results.title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include an action-noir, a South African story of rebellion against apartheid and more.

multimedia.caption: Lelia Symington, right, with Tyler Posey in “Brut Force.”
Lelia Symington, right, with Tyler Posey in “Brut Force.”
Lelia Symington, right, with Tyler Posey in “Brut Force.”

results.title: ‘Cyber Hell’ Review: When Chat Rooms Become Sites of Exploitation
results.abstract: This true-crime documentary, subtitled “Exposing an Internet Horror,” recounts a South Korean case in which chat room operators blackmailed young women into sending explicit videos.
des_facet: Cyber Hell: Exposing an Internet Horror (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The journalist Kim Wan is interviewed in the documentary “Cyber Hell: Exposing an Internet Horror.”
The journalist Kim Wan is interviewed in the documentary “Cyber Hell: Exposing an Internet Horror.”

results.title: ‘Hold Your Fire’ Review: Ending a Siege
results.abstract: A new documentary directed by Stefan Forbes centers on a 1973 hostage negotiation led by a police officer known for his pioneering techniques.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Hold Your Fire,” a documentary about a landmark hostage negotiation in 1973.
A scene from “Hold Your Fire,” a documentary about a landmark hostage negotiation in 1973.
A scene from “Hold Your Fire,” a documentary about a landmark hostage negotiation in 1973.

results.title: ‘Cane Fire’ Review: Here Am I, Your Plundered Island
results.abstract: Burning resentment at colonial exploitation on Kauai, seen through the veil of history’s smoke.

multimedia.caption: Anthony Banua-Simon’s great-grandfather, Albert Banua, in the 1930’s. He was an extra in Lois Weber’s original “Cane Fire.”

results.title: ‘The Valet’ Review: A Crowd Pleasing Buddy Comedy
results.abstract: What seems like a standard rom-com takes a spin in a different direction.

From left, Eugenio Derbez, Amaury Nolasco, Armando Hernández and Carlos Santos in “The Valet.”

results.title: ‘Little Shop of Horrors’ at 40: The Plant That Conquered the World
results.abstract: Members of the cast and creative team from the original production, as well as the current Off Broadway revival, look back on how the show came together and discuss its enduring influence.

multimedia.caption: The cast and creative team of the original production of “Little Shop of Horrors.” In the front at center are Howard Ashman, left, wearing plaid, and Alan Menken, lying on the floor.

results.title: ‘Torn Hearts’ Review: Sequins and Savagery
results.abstract: In this horror movie with a Southern twang, an aspiring country duo seek guidance from their unhinged icon.

multimedia.caption: Abby Quinn, left, and Alexxis Lemire in “Torn Hearts,” directed by Brea Grant.

results.title: David Fincher Tries Animation in ‘Love, Death + Robots’
results.abstract: The director made his first animated short for the new season of this Netflix anthology. “It was an incredibly freeing, eye-opening, mind-expanding way to interface with a story,” he said.

multimedia.caption: “Bad Travelling,” part of the new season of “Love, Death + Robots,” on Netflix, was David Fincher’s first animated short.
“Bad Travelling,” part of the new season of “Love, Death + Robots,” on Netflix, was David Fincher’s first animated short.

results.title: ‘Mondocane’ Review: Fractured Friendship, Fractured World
results.abstract: Two orphaned boys fall in with a criminal gang in this post-apocalyptic thriller.

results.title: Bruce Mau: A Designer Puts Life on the Drawing Boards
results.abstract: A new film about the celebrated graphic designer follows his career as the scale of his projects goes from small to extra large to global.

multimedia.caption: Bruce Mau is the subject of a documentary and career biography, from the designed page to the designed earth.
Bruce Mau is the subject of a documentary and career biography, from the designed page to the designed earth.

results.title: ‘Fire in the Mountains’ Review: The Mother of All Struggles
results.abstract: Vinamrata Rai plays a rural Indian woman driven to the edge by family pressures in Ajitpal Singh’s tough and generous first feature.

multimedia.caption: Vinamrata Rai as Chandra in Ajitpal Singh’s film “Fire in the Mountains,” set in India.

results.title: ‘A New Old Play’ Review: Even the Clown Show Must Go On
results.abstract: Qiu Jiongjiong’s absurdist epic of 20th century China is both a movie and a play, both tragedy and farce.

results.title: ‘Deception’ Review: Verbal Fetishism
results.abstract: In Arnaud Desplechin’s sly adaptation of Philip Roth’s 1990 novel, a middle-aged writer draws inspiration for his next book from discussions with his mistress.

results.title: Rosmarie Trapp, of the ‘Sound of Music’ Family, Dies at 93
results.abstract: She was the last surviving daughter of the baron and the would-be nun depicted in the stage musical and 1965 film.

multimedia.caption: Rosmarie von Trapp, foreground, performing in 1947 with her brother, Johannes, who is now the last surviving sibling in the von Trapp family.

results.title: Nuri Bilge Ceylan’s Masterpiece of Existential Angst
results.abstract: His moody 2004 film, ‘Distant,’ about an unemployed factory worker in Istanbul, has been revived for a short run at Film Forum in Manhattan.

multimedia.caption: In “Distant,” Mehmet Emin Toprak plays Yusuf, who stays with his older cousin while shambolically looking for a job.

results.title: What is Un Certain Regard?
results.abstract: The festival’s largest sidebar of new films is about looking to new horizons and filmmakers.

results.abstract: Marty Callner made the first modern special, setting the template still in use. (He was also key to hair-metal videos. But that’s another story.)
